posts.title: FSU shooting latest: 2 dead, 6 injured; 20-year-old suspect in custody
top_comments:
The son of a local sheriff's deputy allegedly opened fire near the Student Union at Florida State University in Tallahassee on Thursday, killing two people and injuring six others, authorities said.

The suspect -- 20-year-old Phoenix Ikner, a current FSU student -- was shot by responders and has been hospitalized, police said. He was taken into custody with non-life-threatening injuries, multiple law enforcement officials told ABC News.

Ikner is the son of a current Leon County sheriff's deputy, according to Sheriff Walter McNeil. He had access to one of his mother's personal weapons, which was one of the weapons found at the scene, the sheriff said. It appeared Ikner had a handgun and a shotgun with him, police said.

The suspect's mother has been a deputy with the department for more than 18 years and "her service to this community has been exceptional," McNeil said.

The suspect was also a "long-standing member" of the Leon County Sheriff's Office's Youth Advisory Council, McNeil said.

He was "engaged in a number of training programs that we have," the sheriff said, adding, "Not a surprise to us that he had access to weapons."...

So will he be called a domestic-terrorist because of his previous statements made towards people of a certain political party?  

  
Surely they will come down hard on him right?

>The suspect was also a "long-standing member" of the Leon County Sheriff's Office's Youth Advisory Council, McNeil said.

It seems like Leon County Sheriff's Office's is directly working under the satan's guidance.

posts.title: MSU faculty join call for Big Ten 'mutual defense compact' against Trump administration
top_comments: Good. All colleges and universities should stand firm together (except may Liberty University). The legal defense will be the same for all of them.

Just a reminder that while Harvard is getting all the headlines and people are grousing about their endowment, the NIH grant impoundments will affect virtually all universities including those without the resources to challenge the government in court.

Moves like this are great.
United we stand, divided we fall.  We are either all in against tyranny or we are slowly conquered one at a time.
I go to OSU. We fully support this idea

Note this is just the faculty senate and not the administration, ie the employees who wouldn’t interact with governmental officials and not senior leadership who would interact with state and federal officials.

posts.title: A deadly E. coli outbreak hit 15 states, but the FDA chose not to publicize it | NBC News
top_comments: Beginning to sound a lot like Fahrenheit 451, isn't it?

I got sick with food poisoning (salmonella) and because my state has (or at least had) a robust health department, it was traced to a particular restaurant.

Whether or not the restaurant was negligent, or just had the bad luck of having some food that was spoiled, I have no idea. But the health department folks researched it  traced it. Amazing work. This is work that takes having adequate staffing. 

I don't know if this will happen anymore in my state. But I am very appreciative of the staff at the Dept of Health who helped me and told them as much that they were rock stars.

Note this is also after the US FDA suspends over 40,000 workers and food safety checks according to Reuters. [https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-fda-suspends-food-safety-quality-checks-after-staff-cuts-2025-04-17/](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-fda-suspends-food-safety-quality-checks-after-staff-cuts-2025-04-17/)

Highly concerning to US food safety, and wont make it easier for the US to export their agricultural products overseas.
Was Iowa a state? My mom (MAGA) recently had a near-death incident with e-coli. I did tell her it was likely since we were no longer reporting on these outbreaks...
**Censorship by omission**
This government actively wants us dead. "Reducing the surplus population" I guess, not that Trump would understand what that means.
It literally never lists the 15 states in the entire article.
This was under the Biden administration. Imagine how bad it’ll be now with this group of incompetents.

Just a reminder that while Harvard is getting all the headlines and people are grousing about their endowment, the NIH grant impoundments will affect virtually all universities including those without the resources to challenge the government in court.

Moves like this are great.
United we stand, divided we fall.  We are either all in against tyranny or we are slowly conquered one at a time.
I go to OSU. We fully support this idea
Fucking wild that universities need to form defensive alliances to defend themselves from the president of the united states.

Note this is just the faculty senate and not the administration, ie the employees who wouldn’t interact with governmental officials and not senior leadership who would interact with state and federal officials.
It's got to be the Big Ten because they certainly aren't getting the SEC.
U. of M. graduate here, and I endorse this.
This should've been done the minute trump announced a second term.

posts.title: A deadly E. coli outbreak hit 15 states, but the FDA chose not to publicize it | NBC News
top_comments: Beginning to sound a lot like Fahrenheit 451, isn't it?

I got sick with food poisoning (salmonella) and because my state has (or at least had) a robust health department, it was traced to a particular restaurant.

Whether or not the restaurant was negligent, or just had the bad luck of having some food that was spoiled, I have no idea. But the health department folks researched it  traced it. Amazing work. This is work that takes having adequate staffing. 

I don't know if this will happen anymore in my state. But I am very appreciative of the staff at the Dept of Health who helped me and told them as much that they were rock stars.

Note this is also after the US FDA suspends over 40,000 workers and food safety checks according to Reuters. [https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-fda-suspends-food-safety-quality-checks-after-staff-cuts-2025-04-17/](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-fda-suspends-food-safety-quality-checks-after-staff-cuts-2025-04-17/)

posts.title: FSU shooting latest: 2 dead, 6 injured; 20-year-old suspect in custody
top_comments:
The son of a local sheriff's deputy allegedly opened fire near the Student Union at Florida State University in Tallahassee on Thursday, killing two people and injuring six others, authorities said.

The suspect -- 20-year-old Phoenix Ikner, a current FSU student -- was shot by responders and has been hospitalized, police said. He was taken into custody with non-life-threatening injuries, multiple law enforcement officials told ABC News.

Ikner is the son of a current Leon County sheriff's deputy, according to Sheriff Walter McNeil. He had access to one of his mother's personal weapons, which was one of the weapons found at the scene, the sheriff said. It appeared Ikner had a handgun and a shotgun with him, police said.

The suspect's mother has been a deputy with the department for more than 18 years and "her service to this community has been exceptional," McNeil said.

The suspect was also a "long-standing member" of the Leon County Sheriff's Office's Youth Advisory Council, McNeil said.

He was "engaged in a number of training programs that we have," the sheriff said, adding, "Not a surprise to us that he had access to weapons."...

So will he be called a domestic-terrorist because of his previous statements made towards people of a certain political party?
